intro: Brachyscome decipiens, commonly known as the false daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Brachyscome decipiens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
